content.body:
> <@zcorpan:mozilla.org> Do we have any working automation to post commits on X? Per https://developer.x.com/en/docs/twitter-api it should be possible with a free plan

We did but then they shut down our "app" for being a bot. https://github.com/whatwg/participate.whatwg.org/issues/351
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @zcorpan:mozilla.org
Do we have any working automation to post commits on X? Per https://developer.x.com/en/docs/twitter-api it should be possible with a free plan
We did but then they shut down our "app" for being a bot. https://github.com/whatwg/participate.whatwg.org/issues/351

content.body: We can try again, I think there is a path. I just haven't worked up the energy yet. If you want to try that would be welcome.

zcorpan: thank you. I think https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#ref-for-dictionary-member-optional:~:text=In%20the%20JavaScript%20binding%2C%20a,in%20the%20dictionary%20value%20otherwise is what I was looking for, after reading more.
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: thank you. I think https://webidl.spec.whatwg.org/#ref-for-dictionary-member-optional:~:text=In%20the%20JavaScript%20binding%2C%20a,in%20the%20dictionary%20value%20otherwise is what I was looking for, after reading more.

content.body: Maybe posting on the fediverse is less likely to randomly stop working

annevk: Do you why we don't have [Fetch keepalive](https://wpt.fyi/results/?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=keepalive) tests for workers? AFAICT from the spec keepalive is supported for workers as well right?
content.formatted_body: annevk: Do you why we don't have Fetch keepalive tests for workers? AFAICT from the spec keepalive is supported for workers as well right?
